name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Anti-Virus Match - Adware/PUA]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Anti-Virus scan results with matching events for files classified as adware or potentially unwanted applications.
query: class=[crowdstrike,crowdstrike_falconhost] ([category,rule]=ngav OR [eventname,eventtype]=`av scan results in a detection summary event`) ([result,virus]:[`adware`,`unwanted-program`,`potentially unwanted`,`installcore`,`fusioncore`,`not-a-virus`,`[adw]`,/\bpu[ap]\b/] OR [msg,description]:`adware` OR [args,process]:[`\amagent.exe`,`\amsvc.exe`,`\swsys.exe`]) NOT [msg,description]:&[`machine learning`,`malicious files`] NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Anti-Virus Match - Malware]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Anti-Virus scan results with matching events. Files classified as adware or potentially unwanted applications are excluded from this rule.
query: class=[crowdstrike,crowdstrike_falconhost] ([category,rule]=ngav OR [eventname,eventtype]=`av scan results in a detection summary event`) NOT ([result,virus]:[`adware`,`unwanted-program`,`potentially unwanted`,`installcore`,`fusioncore`,`not-a-virus`,`[adw]`,/\bpu[ap]\b/] OR [msg,description]:`adware` OR [args,process]:[`\amagent.exe`,`\amsvc.exe`,`\swsys.exe`]) NOT [msg,description]:&[`machine learning`,`malicious files`] NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Machine Learning - Malicious File]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon events for machine learning-based malicious file detections.

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Blocked Exploit]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Blocked Exploit events. The exploitation technique that was blocked is specified in the msg or description field.

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Overwatch Detection]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Overwatch Detection events.

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Suspicious Activity]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Suspicious Activity events. The type of activity that was detected is specified in the eventname, eventtype, msg, and description fields.
query: class=[crowdstrike,crowdstrike_falconhost] [category,rule]=`suspicious activity` NOT [eventname,eventtype]=`av scan results in a detection summary event` NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Malicious Document]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Malicious Document events.

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Server Compromise]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Server Compromise events.

name: CROWDSTRIKE FALCON [Attacker Methodology]
description: This rule looks for CrowdStrike Falcon Attacker Methodology events. The attacker methodology that was detected is specified in the msg or description field.
